meanings.definition: The act of introducing something into a place or group.
meanings.sent1: His intromissions of new ideas into the team meetings always sparked interesting discussions.
meanings.sent2: The intromissions of fresh flowers into the room brought a pleasant fragrance.
meanings.sent3: The intromissions of colorful balloons into the office made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her intromissions of creativity into the project were like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The intromissions of sunlight into the dark room instantly lifted everyone's spirits.

meanings.definition: The act of interfering or meddling in someone else's affairs.
meanings.sent1: His constant intromissions in their relationship caused unnecessary drama.
meanings.sent2: The intromissions of the nosy neighbor often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: Her intromissions in their conversation made them both laugh at her boldness.
meanings.sent4: The intromissions of the gossiping coworker spread like wildfire in the office.
meanings.sent5: His intromissions in their dispute only made the situation more complicated.
